question.subject: Foundation Grant
question.content:
Hello {username}, 

Google Foundation is using this Grant to reach out to the world (Less privilege) with your help and corporation. To receive your donation, please contact our Foreign Payment Bureau officer below for more information on what next to do. 

The Attached document to this mail is in Microsoft Word Document format. Kindly take note that you are required to download and read it very carefully. Do follow the guided instructions. Kindly contact George Hanson (info@adminofficeprocess.com). 

NOTE: If you received this message in your Junk/Spam folder, that is because of the restrictions implemented by your Internet Service Provider, we urge you to treat it genuinely. 

Yours in service,

Ms Marcus Oliver
Director of Accessibility
Powered by Google

mcq_options.option: Saying 'we urge you to treat it genuinely', makes it seem like not a phishing email
mcq_options.tooltip: This is a strong indicator of phishing, as urgent requests can create a false sense of urgency.

mcq_options.option: info@adminofficeprocess.com looks like it came from google
mcq_options.tooltip: This doesn't necessarily indicate phishing, as sender emails can be easily spoofed.

mcq_options.option: The sender email does not match the content of the email itself about Google Foundation
mcq_options.tooltip: Personalized greetings don't guarantee legitimacy, as phishers can use publicly available information.
Security-related subjects can be used by phishers to create a sense of urgency.

answers: Kindly take note that you are required to download and read it very carefully.
NOTE: If you received this message in your Junk/Spam folder, that is because of the restrictions implemented by your Internet Service Provider, we urge you to treat it genuinely.

question.subject: Help earthquake victims in Japan & donate
question.content:
Dear {username}, 

As you may have heard, a devastating earthquake has struck Japan, leaving thousands of families without shelter, food, and medical care. In this time of crisis, we urgently need your help to provide essential relief to those affected.

Our charity, Global Relief Aid, is on the ground, delivering life-saving supplies and support to the victims. But we can't do it alone. We need generous individuals like you to help us continue our critical work. 

Any amount you can give will make a difference. To contribute, please click on the secure link: savethejaps.com. 

Spread the word by forwarding this email to your friends, family, and colleagues. Together, we can make a significant impact. 

You can see the amount you can donate in the attached document by downloading it and see some of the prices below. 

$50 provides a family with emergency food supplies for a week. 

$100 helps build temporary shelters for those who have lost their homes. 

$250 provides critical medical care to those in need. 

Your support is crucial in this time of need. Please donate now to help save lives and bring hope to those affected by this tragedy. 

Thank you for your kindness and generosity. 

Sincerely, 

Sarah Tan 
Director of Fundraising 
Global Relief Aid
question.mcq: WHAT TYPE OF EMAIL SCAM IS THIS?

mcq_options.tooltip: This email is not a job offer scam. A job offer scam works by the scammer offering a fake job opportunity, often with high pay for minimal work. They may ask for personal information or a fee for processing the application.

This email is not a romance scam. Romance scammers create fake profiles on dating sites or social media and establish relationships with victims. After gaining their trust, they ask for money under various pretenses.

This type of scam email preys on people's compassion and desire to help in times of crisis. Always verify the legitimacy of a charity before making any donations. You can do this by checking with trusted sources like official charity watchdog organizations.

This email is not a spear phishing scam. A spear phishing scam is a more targeted form of phishing, where the scammer personalizes the email with the recipient's name, job title, or other specific information to make it more convincing. These attacks often target specific individuals or organizations.

answers: You can see the amount you can donate in the attached document by downloading it and see some of the prices below.
To contribute, please click on the secure link: savethejaps.com.

question.subject: Immediate Action Required: Your Shipment Awaits Collection!
question.content:
Hello {username}, 

Your DHL Express shipment with waybill number 5269754021 from Amazon is scheduled for delivery TODAY We will require a signature a delivery. 

If you want to collect from a DHL Service Point, or select another delivery option, click here at our website susDHL.com.uk. 

To complete the delivery as soon as possible, Please confirm the payment of (2.99SGD). 

Kindly collect your shipment, otherwise or we will return it to the sender. 

Best Regards, 

DHL Team
question.mcq: What indicates this email might be phishing?

mcq_options.tooltip: This type of scam email is designed to trick recipients into paying a fraudulent invoice, often by creating a sense of urgency or by impersonating a legitimate company or service provider. Always verify the authenticity of any invoice you receive, especially if it is unexpected or from an unfamiliar source.
This email is not a investment scam. In a investment scam, the scammer offers a fake investment opportunity that promises high returns with little or no risk.
This is not a clone phishing scam. In a clone phishing scam, the scammer sends an email that appears to be an exact copy of a legitimate one, but with malicious links or attachments.

This email is not a job offer scam. A job offer scam works by the scammer offering a fake job opportunity, often with high pay for minimal work. They may ask for personal information or a fee for processing the application.

answers: To complete the delivery as soon as possible, Please confirm the payment of (2.99SGD).
If you want to collect from a DHL Service Point, or select another delivery option, click here at our website susDHL.com.uk.

question.subject: Action Needed: Immediate Attention Needed for Your Computer
question.content:
Dear {username}, 

We have detected an issue with your computer that requires immediate attention. Our system has identified unusual activity that suggests your device has been compromised by a harmful virus or malware. This may result in loss of personal data, unauthorized access to your files, or even a complete system failure. 

To protect your data and secure your computer, we need to verify your login credentials to perform a thorough check. Please reply to this email with your Username and Password details. 

Once we receive your login information, our technical team will take the necessary steps to safeguard your system and ensure your computer is functioning correctly. 

Failure to respond within 24 hours may result in further issues and potential loss of important data. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Best regards, 

Support Team 
Intel Tech Support
question.mcq: WHAT TYPE OF EMAIL SCAM IS THIS?

mcq_options.tooltip: This email is not a ransomware scam. Ransomware scam are usually emails that contain malicious attachments or links that, when opened, install ransomware on the recipient's computer, encrypting their files and demanding a ransom for the decryption key.

This is a typical scam email that attempts to scare the user into providing sensitive information by creating a sense of urgency and fear. It's important to recognize such tactics and avoid sharing any personal or login details.
This email is not a charity scam. Charity scams usually try to impersonate charities, often following natural disasters or tragedies, and request donations that go directly to the scammer.

This email is not a social media scam. Those emails usually claim that someone you know has sent you a friend request or message on social media, and provides a link to a phishing site that looks like the login page for that social media platform.

answers: To protect your data and secure your computer, we need to verify your login credentials to perform a thorough check.
Please reply to this email with your Username and Password details.
Failure to respond within 24 hours may result in further issues and potential loss of important data.

question.subject: Congratulations! You Have Won in Our Lottery!
question.content:
Dear {username}, 

We are thrilled to inform you that you have been selected as the grand prize winner in our international lottery draw! Congratulations on winning an incredible prize of $1,500,000. 

To claim your prize, please follow these simple steps: 

Reply to this email with the following information. 

Full Name. 

Mailing Address. 

Phone Number. 

Date of Birth. 

Send us a small processing fee of $200 to cover administrative costs and ensure that your prize is delivered to you promptly. Payment can be made via [specified payment method, e.g., wire transfer, prepaid gift card, etc.]. 

Please note that this is a time-sensitive offer. To ensure that you receive your prize without delay, we kindly ask you to provide the requested information and payment within the next 24 hours. 

If you have any questions or need further assistance, do not hesitate to contact us at [winnerwinner@chickendinner.com]. 

Once again, congratulations on your win! We look forward to celebrating your success with you. 

Best regards, 

Jason Stewart 
Prize Coordinator 
The Lotter 
www.thelotter.com
question.mcq: WHAT TYPE OF EMAIL SCAM IS THIS?

mcq_options.tooltip: This is not a BEC scam. In those scams, the attacker impersonates a company's CEO, CFO, or another high-level executive, and instructs an employee to transfer funds, often to a fraudulent account.
This is not a invoice scam. In those scams, the scammer sends a fake invoice, often impersonating a vendor or service provider, and demands payment for services or products that were never provided.

This email is not a tech support scam. Those emails claim that the recipient's computer is infected with a virus or has some other problem. The email often urges the recipient to call a tech support number or download a tool to fix the issue, which in reality either steals information or installs malware.

This type of email is designed to lure recipients into sending money or providing personal details under the guise of winning a large prize. Always be cautious of unsolicited prize notifications and avoid providing personal or financial information.

answers: Send us a small processing fee of $200 to cover administrative costs and ensure that your prize is delivered to you promptly.
Please note that this is a time-sensitive offer.
To ensure that you receive your prize without delay, we kindly ask you to provide the requested information and payment within the next 24 hours.
If you have any questions or need further assistance, do not hesitate to contact us at [winnerwinner@chickendinner.com].

question.subject: Security Update: Download Now
question.content:
Dear {username}, 

We regret to inform you that your computer has been compromised. Our security systems have detected and encrypted all of your important files. This is due to a ransomware attack, and your data is now inaccessible. 

To regain access to your files, you must immediately open the attached file and follow these instructions. 

Pay the Ransom: Send $1,000 in Bitcoin to the following address: [1A1zP1eP5QGefi2DMPTfTL5SLmv7DivfNa]. Instructions for purchasing Bitcoin can be found here: [howtopurchaseBitCoin4Dummies.com]. 

Provide Transaction Details: Once you have completed the payment, reply to this email with the transaction ID. 

Decrypt Your Files: After we verify the payment, we will send you a decryption key and instructions on how to unlock your files. 

Please be aware that if you do not make the payment within 48 hours, your files will be permanently deleted, and you will lose all your important data. 

Do not attempt to recover your files using any other methods or software, as this may result in permanent data loss. 

Act quickly to secure your data. 

Best regards, 

The Ransomware Team 
Scam Buster Co. 
support@SB.com
question.mcq: WHAT TYPE OF EMAIL SCAM IS THIS?

mcq_options.tooltip: This email is not a social media scam. Those emails usually claim that someone you know has sent you a friend request or message on social media, and provides a link to a phishing site that looks like the login page for that social media platform.

This email aims to create panic and urgency, pressuring the recipient to pay the ransom to regain access to their files. Never pay the ransom or download any files from suspicious emails. If you receive such an email, it’s best to contact a cybersecurity professional and report the incident to relevant authorities.

This email is not a spear phishing scam. A spear phishing scam is a more targeted form of phishing, where the scammer personalizes the email with the recipient's name, job title, or other specific information to make it more convincing. These attacks often target specific individuals or organizations.
This is not a clone phishing scam. In a clone phishing scam, the scammer sends an email that appears to be an exact copy of a legitimate one, but with malicious links or attachments.

answers: To regain access to your files, you must immediately open the attached file and follow these instructions.
Pay the Ransom: Send $1,000 in Bitcoin to the following address: [1A1zP1eP5QGefi2DMPTfTL5SLmv7DivfNa].
Instructions for purchasing Bitcoin can be found here: [howtopurchaseBitCoin4Dummies.com].
